data.name: AdminHelpRemarks
data.value: This command can only be used through a DM to the bot

data.name: AdminHelpSummary
data.value: Returns a list of available admin commands and their parameters, or if specified, details about a specific admin command.

data.name: ApproveChannelRemarks
data.value: This command can only be used through a DM to the bot

data.name: ApproveChannelSummary
data.value: This command will approve the currently pending request that is requesting the specified channel name

data.name: ApproveEmojiRemarks
data.value: This command can only be used through a DM to the bot

data.name: ApproveEmojiSummary
data.value: This command will approve the currently pending emoji that is requesting the specified shortcut

data.name: CreateGroupRemarks
data.value: The command will fail if a role with the specified name already exists.

data.name: CreateGroupSummary
data.value: Creates a new mentionable group with the name given by the roleName parameter.

data.name: DeleteGroupRemarks
data.value: This command will not allow you to delete roles that are not custom mention groups. This command will also not allow you to delete a custom mention group if there are users currently part of the group.

data.name: DeleteGroupSummary
data.value: This command will delete the specified custom mention group.

data.name: HelpSummary
data.value: Returns a list of available commands and their parameters, or if specified, details about a specific command.

data.name: JoinGroupRemarks
data.value: The command will fail if you try to join an unjoinable group.

data.name: JoinGroupSummary
data.value: Use to add yourself to an existing mentionable group.

data.name: LeaveGroupSummary
data.value: Use to leave a mentionable group that you are currently part of.

data.name: LeaveGrroupRemarks
data.value: The command will fail if you are not part of the group, or if you do not have permission to leave the specified role.

data.name: ListGroupsSummary
data.value: Displays a list of all the available mentionable groups that you can join.

data.name: ListMembersRemarks
data.value: The command will fail if the specified mention group is not a custom group that was created with the creategroup command.

data.name: ListMembersSummary
data.value: This command lists all the members in the specified mention group.

data.name: ListPendingChannelsRemarks
data.value: This command can only be used through a DM to the bot

data.name: ListPendingChannelsSummary
data.value: This command will list the currently pending channels awaiting approval

data.name: ListPendingEmojisRemarks
data.value: This command can only be used through a DM to the bot

data.name: ListPendingEmojisSummary
data.value: This command will list the currently pending emojis awaiting approval

data.name: RejectChannelRemarks
data.value: This command can only be used through a DM to the bot

data.name: RejectChannelSummary
data.value: This command will reject the currently pending request that is requesting the specified channel name, and will then ping the user indicating why the channel was rejected

data.name: RejectEmojiRemarks
data.value: This command can only be used through a DM to the bot

data.name: RejectEmojiSummary
data.value: This command will reject the currently pending emoji that is requesting the specified shortcut, and will then ping the user indicating why the emoji is rejected

data.name: RemoveLastMessagesRemarks
data.value: 1) This command can be used in any channel (it is not limited only to the Bot Channel).\r\n\r\n2) This command will only remove 10 messages at a time at most.

data.name: RemoveLastMessagesSummary
data.value: This command will remove the last X number of messages from the current channel.

data.name: RequestChannelRemarks
data.value:
1) Channels can only have names containing alphanumeric characters, dashes or underscores. 
2) You cannot specify a channel name that exists, or is already being requested for use. 
3) You may optionally specify which category you would like to add the text channel under. The text channel will automatically inherit all permissions associated with this category. 
4) If you are getting the error "Channel name not found.", it is because the specified category does not exist. You may also see this error if you put spaces in the channel name.

data.name: RequestChannelSummary
data.value: Use this command to request a text channel to be added to the server. Optionally specify a category to put the channel in.

data.name: RequestEmojiRemarks
data.value:
1) You can only use this command with either a url of the image, or a single image attachment (cannot use both).

2) To use the command with an image upload, first upload the image as an attachment to the bot channel. When it asks you type in an optional message with the attachment, enter the command.

3) To use the command with a url of the image, you must ensure the url is a direct url to the image.

4) If you upload an emoji with a shortcut name matching one that is already pending, the new emoji request will replace the existing one.

data.name: RequestEmojiSummary
data.value: Use this command to request an emoji to be added to the server. Emojis can either be provided by direct upload, or a direct url to an image.

data.name: SayRemarks
data.value: This command can only be used through a DM to the bot

data.name: SaySummary
data.value: Use this command to say the specified message into the bot channel.

data.name: SpoilerRemarks
data.value: 1) This command can be used in all guild channels. \r\n2) Spoiler messages cannot be greater than 300 characters in size. \r\n3) The spoiler effect works well on desktop, but does not work as well on mobile, due to the differences in how gifs are embeded in a message.

data.name: SpoilerSummary
data.value: Embeds the specified message into a spoiler, that will display the hidden message on mouse hover.
